title: Bug 113047 - No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab.
description: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab. Closing the data set editor and reopening it does not resolve the issue.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes.
EB: The data set editor page should display a listing of children nodes when changing the data source for a data set. Closing and reopening the data set editor should not be necessary to resolve the issue.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. In the data set editor, go to the data source page.
3. Change the data source to a new one.
4. Observe that the new data source has no database/table/column information listed as children nodes. 
5. Close the data set editor and reopen it to see if the issue persists.
